li.a: EPS Parents and Cargivers Virtual Form

div.a: Teens Tweens and Quarantines-SPIFFY-Flyer-4C w links
BOH ORDER for Parks, Courts, Etc. (1)

div.p: Due to an abundance of safety, the Easthampton Public Schools will be postponing kindergarten registration, scheduled for March 12, 2020, and kindergarten tours, scheduled for March 13, 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
We are taking measures to limit the number of people who have access to our buildings to keep our staff and students healthy. At this time, we have 0 cases of COVID-19.
The district will be reviewing these types of decisions within 30 days or as needed.
Thank you for your patience as we address this ever-evolving situation.
To view the Massachusetts Department of Elementary And Secondary Education 2019 District Report Card for Easthampton Public Schools – Click Here

li.a: New School Building Project Update Sign-up

p.strong: Are you an Easthampton resident interested in getting updates or information about the new school project?
If you would like to be added to our distribution list, please click on the link below, complete and submit the Form.

h6.em: Families and staff of EPS are already in our database, please do not complete this form.

li.a: EPS New Interim Assistant Principal Announcement

div.p: Superintendent LeClair has appointed Mr. Daniel Stern, EPS Educational Team Facilitator as the new Interim Assistant Principal at White Brook Middle School.

p.span: accepting his position as the Interim Assistant Principal at White Brook Middle School, he
rior to joining Easthampton Public Schools
Associate Principal of Special Alternative Education at the Lower Pioneer Valley Educational Collaborative

li.a: EHS We The People Wins State Championship 3rd Year in a Row!!
Maple School Grand Reveal of their All Ability Preschool Playground

div.class: n2-ss-widget n2-ss-widget-display-desktop n2-ss-widget-display-tablet n2-ss-widget-display-mobile nextend-arrow n2-ow nextend-arrow-previous nextend-arrow-animated-fade n2-ib

h6.span: Sincere gratitude to Dan Stern for spearheading and guiding the entire project from concept to completion; the Maple School Staff; the PTO and community members; Daniel Rist (CPA) ; the Finance Sub Committee members; Jamie Webb (Planning Department); Joseph Pipczynski and staff (DPW); Greg Nuttleman (Utilities Supervisor) and; Larry Carnes and Jason Potts (EPSD).

div.p: Superintendent LeClair has appointed Dr. Pasquini-Torchia, Assistant Principal at White Brook Middle School as the new Principal for Center Pepin Elementary Schools.

p.span: at she has been dedicated to for the
an elementary Principal in South Hadley
the success of our school district as she is
with children in our schools, one at White Brook Middle School and one at Center Pepin Elementary Schools.
is a known entity to many teachers and families
through her children and as an administrator at
is well respected with established rapports with
Center Pepin Elementary Schools, Andrea McCallum.
Dr. Pasquini-Torchia is an exceptional leader, has a strong background, and
steer the ship to forward, without skipping a beat at Center Pepin Elementary Schools and hope to appoint to a leadership role in our new PK-8 School.

div.p: EPS 2019-2020 School Calendar- Click Here to View

Are you interested in becoming a substitute teacher? The Easthampton Public Schools are seeking substitutes for all levels. Do you have a day or two each week? Are you seeking a position with flexibility? Consider being a substitute teacher. Applications are available at the district office, located at 50 Payson Street, 2nd Floor. CORI and fingerprints are required.

li.a: EPS Public Release for Free & Reduced Priced Meals Update
EHS World Language Club Annual Craft Fair Benefit, This Saturday, October 26, 2019
EPS Grateful for the Easthampton Learning Foundation’s Continued Support

span.style: display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #666666; cursor: text; font-family: Georgia,'Times New Roman','Bitstream Charter',Times,serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

p.span: Thank-you to the Easthampton Learning Foundation for their continued support of the educators at Easthampton Public Schools.

div.p: On Wednesday, Dr. LeClair received a check from the ELF Executive Committee members, Mr. Chuck McCullagh, Mr. Stanley Paulauskas, and Mr. Tom Brown.
